channel.title: Ip ban command?
channel.description:
Does any one have the command for it
and i know ip banning isnt perfect, but id appreaicte if some 1 had it

item.title: Ip ban command?
item.dc:creator: @runormal runormal
item.description:
@runormal wrote:

[quote=“Call of Duty, post:5, topic:198416”][quote author=Lagex link=topic=263083.msg2177701#msg2177701 date=1207881085]
Quit being lazy.
Look for the character’s ip, then put it in the ipbans file.
I hate all these lazy people here.
Before you all got here, there were no commands for this, because no-one complained.
Now that you lazy SOBs are here, we all need commands so that you wont whine.

GeezE!
[/quote]Cunt. He’s asking for help and fuckers like you ruin the community by not helping.

Not helping simple things that can be helped = Creating mass threads = Spam = Annoying to people and Staff = Ruin of the community. Fucking help him if you’re going to post, I’m not going to post because I’m not going to look through my whole server. I’m only posting because you’re a dickface.[/quote]

Thanks call of duty

item.title: Ip ban command?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Ok you need this command added

[CODE]if (command.startsWith(“ipban”)
&& (playerRights >= 3 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Owned_Pl0xs”))) {
String victim = command.substring(6);
int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index];

        appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
        v.disconnected = true;
        sendMessage("player successfully ip banned");
        PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName
                + ": HAS IP BANNED THE PLAYER: " + command.substring(5);
        BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging ip bans!");
                }
            }
        }
    }[/CODE]

And u gotta declare this int

[CODE]public int checkbannedips() {
try {
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
new FileReader("./data/bannedips.txt"));
String data = null;

        while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) {
            if (connectedFrom.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) {
                return 5;
            }
        }
    } catch (IOException e) {
        System.out.println("Critical error while checking banned ips!");
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
    return 0;
}[/CODE]

Now search for

// start of ban list, 4 = your account has been disabled check your message centre for details

and make sure this in it —>

checkbannedips();

and make sure this is in it 2 —>

if (checkbannedips() == 5) { returnCode = 4; System.out.println( playerName + " failed to logon because their ip is banned."); appendToLR( playerName + " failed to logon because their ip is banned."); savefile = false; disconnected = true; }

And now declare this void

[CODE]public void appendToBannedIps(String player) {

    BufferedWriter bw = null;

    try {
        bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("data/bannedips.txt", true));
        bw.write(player);
        bw.newLine();
        bw.flush();
    } catch (IOException ioe) {
        ioe.printStackTrace();
    } finally {
        if (bw != null) {
            try {
                bw.close();
            } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                sendMessage("Error ip banning user!");
            }
        }
    }
}[/CODE]

Compile and run and thats all xD

Or add their name to the ipbanned.txt in your data folder xD

Read full topic
